jml.parser
Class Tokenizer

java.lang.Object
  jml.parser.Tokenizer
Direct Known Subclasses:
FileTokenizer
public class Tokenizer
extends java.lang.Object

Title: SimpleStreamTokenizer

Description: A simple stream tokenizer, where the token separators are the blank characters, (space, enter, tab). The posible tokens are number or word

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2004

Company: Universidad Nacional de Colombia

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jonatan Gomez

public java.util.Vector getTokens()
Obtains a list of the tokens readed by the tokenizer. Does not include the eof token

Returns:

                               java.util.Vector tokens)
remove one o more tokens of a given vector depending of its type and value

Parameters:
token - token object to remove from the vector

close

public void close()
Closes the input stream

nextToken

public Token nextToken()
Reads the available token in the input stream. If there are not more tokens returns ttEOF indicating that the end of the input stream has been reached. If the token is a number then the value of the number is stored in the nval attribute. If the token is not a number the token is stored in the sval attribute.

Returns:
Type of the token read. If the parse process fails then ttERROR is returned.
